question: India has signed an agreement with which organisation for 177-million-dollar loan to upgrade road infrastructure in Maharashtra?
explanation:
The Government of India has signed a loan agreement with Asian Development Bank (ADB) for a loan of USD 177 million. The proceeds of the loan would be used for upgrading 450 kilometres of state highways in Maharashtra.
The project is expected to boost the road connectivity between rural and urban centres in Maharashtra for better access to markets and services.
